Vector Space Rules

If \(u,v,w \in V \quad \& \quad k \in F \) then V is a Vector Space
Addition:
  1. \(u+v \in V\) (Closure)
  2. \(u + v = v + u\) (Commutativity)
  3. \(u+(v+w) = (u+v)+w\) (Associativity)
  4. \(u+O_V = u\) ( \(O_V\) is the zero Vector)
  5. \(u+(-u) = O_V\) (\(-u\) is called additive inverse)
Multiplication:
  1. \(ku \in V\) (Closure)
  2. \(k(u+v) = ku + kv\)
  3. \((k_1 + k_2)u = k_1u+k_2u\)
  4. \(k_1(k_2u) = (k_1k_2)u\)
